events.message: The insured filed a claim reporting a collision involving their vehicle on the highway during rush hour.
After reviewing the claim details, the case was categorised under Auto Accident due to reported collision damages.
A claims agent was assigned to manage the case and to communicate with the claimant for next steps.
The claim was officially acknowledged with confirmation sent to the insured including the claim reference number.
The agent requested photographs of the damaged vehicle and a police report to proceed with claim assessment.
The claimant submitted all required documents including photos and the official police report within the deadline.
A formal investigation was initiated to verify the claimant’s account and inspect the vehicle damages.
Investigation findings confirmed the collision circumstances align with the claimant’s report and damages reported.
A settlement offer was drafted and proposed based on repair estimates and policy coverage limits.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the communication process.
The claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the claimant.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and disbursed to the insured’s nominated bank account.
The claim file was closed after payment confirmation and final satisfaction feedback from the claimant.
All claim documentation and correspondence were archived securely for future reference and compliance.
